author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: فَسُبْحَانَكَ اللَّهُمَّ يا إِلهِي أَسْئَلُكَ بِاسْمِكَ الَّذِيْ بِهِ اسْتَقَرَّ جَمالُكَ عَلَى عَرْشِ أَمْرِكَ، وَبِاسْمِكَ الَّذِيْ بِهِ تُبَدِّلُ كُلَّ شَيْءٍ وَتَحْشُرُ كُلَّ شَيْءٍ وَتَسْأَلُ عَنْ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ وَتَجْزِيْ كُلَّ شَيْءٍ وَتَحْفَظُ كُلَّ شَيْءٍ وَتَرْزُقُ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ، وَتَرْفَعُ كُلَّ شَيْءٍ بِأَنْ تَحْفَظَ هذِهِ الأَمَةَ الَّتِيْ لاذَتْ لِجِنابِكَ وَالْتَجَأَتْ بِمَظْهَرِ نَفْسِكَ وَ
translation: Glory be to Thee, O Lord my God! I beg of Thee by Thy Name through which He Who is Thy Beauty hath been stablished upon the throne of Thy Cause, and by Thy Name through which Thou changest all things, and gatherest together all things, and callest to account all things, and rewardest all things, and preservest all things, and sustainest all things—I beg of Thee to guard this handmaiden who hath fled for refuge to Thee, and hath sought the shelter of Him in Whom Thou Thyself art manifest, and hath put her whole trust and confidence in Thee.
